info.description: Moving your existing data center to the cloud does not have to take up so much time and effort. IBM Cloud for VMware Solutions lets you deploy a comprehensive portfolio of automated and on-demand services for VMware workloads to the cloud, faster than ever before. And by capturing your data center infrastructure as patterns, you have a seamless path to bring your data center to the IBM Cloud without converting virtual machines or changing existing tools and skill sets.
info.title: IBM Cloud for VMware Solutions API

post.summary: Set the IBM Cloud infrastructure account user ID and API key for linked IBM Cloud account
post.description: If no request body is provided, retrieve the user name and API key for the IBM Cloud infrastructure account that is linked to the current IBM Cloud account. Then enter the information in the VMware Solutions account settings. If a request body is provided, set the provided user name and API key for the IBM Cloud infrastructure account in the VMware Solutions account settings.

requestBody.description: The IBM Cloud infrastructure account information. The provided IBM Cloud infrastructure account ID should be consistent with the provided user name and API key.

200.description: Success. The request has been successfully performed.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

post.summary: Order a new vCenter Server instance or verify the order.
post.description: Order a new vCenter Server instance or verify the order with specified configurations.

curl.name: Example request (Use quotation marks for URL with parameters)

200.description: Success. The request has been successfully verified.

202.description: Success. The request for creating the vCenter Server instance has been accepted.

patch.summary: Delete hosts from a specified cluster
patch.description: Delete hosts from a specified cluster for a specified vCenter Server instance.

action.description: Action to be performed against the specified hosts. 'delete' is the only supported value.

hosts.description: List of host IDs to be deleted. Delete these specified hosts from a specified cluster.

curl.name: Example request

202.description: Success. The request for deleting the specified hosts has been accepted.

post.description: Add new shared storages to a specified cluster for a specified vCenter Server instance.

200.description: Success. The request has been successfully verified.

patch.summary: Delete NFS storages from a specified cluster

action.description: Action to be performed against the specified shared storages. 'delete' is the only supported value.

requestBody.description: NFS storage ID list for deleting.

curl.name: Example request

202.description: Success. The request for deleting the specified nfs storage has been accepted.

get.description: Get the list of supported server types per location or vSphere version as a JSON object. The key name is the given location value or the vSphere version value. If no location or vSphere version is given, the key name is "server_types.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation per location.

get.summary: List all vCenter Server instances as a JSON object
get.description: List all the vCenter Server instances that the user can access. The key name is "vcenters".

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

get.summary: List all history messages for a specified vCenter Server instance as a JSON object
get.description: List all the history messages in a specified vCenter Server instance within the specified time frame. If the history messages are obtained, the key name is "history_messages". Otherwise the key name is "errors".

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date from when history messages are retrieved. If it is not specified, the date when the instance was deployed is used. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date to when history messages are retrieved. If it is not specified, the current date is used. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

get.summary: List all the clusters for a specified vCenter Server instance as a JSON object
get.description: List all the clusters that are deployed in a specified vCenter Server instance as a JSON object. If the clusters are obtained, the key name is "clusters". Otherwise the key name is "errors".

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

get.summary: Retrieve the detailed network interface of a cluster as a JSON object
get.description: Retrieve the detailed information of network interface for a specified cluster as a JSON object. If the detailed network interface information is obtained, the key name is "array_vlans". Otherwise the key name is "errors".

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

patch.summary: Update or delete variables of service instance
patch.description: Add, modify, or delete the variables of a service instance.

action.description: The action to be performed against the specified variables of a service instance. The only supported values are 'update' and 'delete'.

variables.description: The list of variables requested to be updated or deleted for a service instance.

name.description: The name of the variable to be updated or deleted.

item_ids.description: The sub-item IDs in the list or dictionary keys that need to be deleted.

value.description: The new values specified for the variables. The new values are in free-form JSON format, and they are used only when the performed action is 'update'.

requestBody.description: The list of variables to be updated or deleted for a service instance.

curl.name: Example request for variable update
Example request for variable deletion

202.description: Success. The request for updating or deleting the specified service variables has been accepted.

variables.description: The name list of the variables that were updated or removed.

name.description: The name of the variable that was updated or removed.

transaction_id.name: x-global-transaction-id
transaction_id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Your IBM Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) token. To retrieve your IAM token, run `ibmcloud iam oauth-tokens`.

verify_only.name: verify_only
verify_only.description: Whether to verify the order only instead of performing the order for real.

check_price.name: check_price
check_price.description: Whether to display the high-level price associated with the order.

installed_only.name: installed_only
installed_only.description: If set to true, services with REMOVED state will be excluded. Otherwise, services with INSTALLED, INSTALLING, REMOVING, REMOVED, and FAILEDVALIDATION states will be returned.

remote_cluster.name: remote_cluster
remote_cluster.description: Allow order at high latency data center or not

location.name: location
location.description: Optional. The default value is all locations.

vsphere_version.name: vsphere_version
vsphere_version.description: Optional. The default value is all supported vSphere versions.

retrieve_only.name: retrieve_only
retrieve_only.description: Whether to only retrieve the IBM Cloud infrastructure API user information.

400.description: Bad request. Check your request parameters.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

401.description: Unauthorized. The IAM token is invalid or expired. To retrieve your IAM token, run `ibmcloud login` and then `ibmcloud iam oauth-tokens`.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

403.description: Forbidden. Access to the specified resource is not authorized. Check the IAM access policy for the `VMware Solutions` service.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

404.description: Not found. The resource cannot be found.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

409.description: Conflict. The request cannot be completed because of a conflict with the current state of the target resource.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

500.description: Internal server error. Your request cannot be processed. Please wait a few minutes and try again.

x-global-transaction-id.description: Global transaction ID for request correlation.

name.description: New VMware instance name that must be unique in your account.

location.description: Data center location. To list available data center locations, use the `GET /v2/locations` API.

root_domain.description: Root domain of the VMware vSphere hosts.

host_prefix.description: Hostname prefix of the VMware vSphere hosts.

subdomain.description: Subdomain of the VMware vSphere hosts.

domain_type.description: Domain type. "primary" is the only supported value currently.

dns_type.description: Active Directory DNS type. Valid values are "vsi" or "ha_vm".

vsphere_version.description: vSphere version. To list supported vSphere versions, use the `GET /v2/vsphere_versions` API. Use "latest" to specify the latest supported vSphere version.

resource_group.description: Resource group ID. To list resource groups, see the Resource Manager API for IBM Cloud. By default, the default resource group ID in the account is used.

hourly.description: Whether hosts should be billed hourly or monthly (default). Currently for AT&T only

services.description: list of services to be added on bringup.

public_vlan.description: Data for an existing public VLAN to use for vCenter

additional_private_vlan.description: Data for an existing additional private VLAN to use for vCenter

quantity.description: Number of new hosts to be added.

template_id.description: The template ID that maps to a preconfigured hardware specification to be ordered. To see supported templates, use the `GET /v2/templates` API. To customize your hardware configuration, use `customized_hardware`. This will be ignored if `customized_hardware` is also specified. If using hourly packages, this must be defined along with the hourly flag.

maintenance_mode.description: Whether to put the new hosts into maintenance mode after they are added.

hourly.description: Whether hosts should be billed hourly or monthly (default)

vsphere_version.description: The vSphere version for the host OS

multi_cluster.description: Customized hardware configuration to be ordered.

edge_cluster_data.description: Edge services cluster configuration for add cluster operation.

cluster_name.description: New cluster name that must be unique for the specified instance.

cluster_type.description: Cluster type.  For edge services clusters, the required value is `edge`.

quantity.description: Number of bare metal servers. For edge services clusters, the required value is `2`.

mcv_mgmt.description: Management cluster configuration of the multizone VMware instance.

To customize your hardware configuration, use `customized_hardware`. This will be ignored if `customized_hardware` is also specified.

witness.description: Witness cluster configuration of the multizone VMware instance.

cluster_name.description: New cluster name that must be unique for the specified instance.

template_id.description: The template ID that maps to a preconfigured hardware specification to be ordered. To see supported templates, use the `GET /v2/templates` API. To customize your hardware configuration, use `customized_hardware`. This will be ignored if `customized_hardware` is also specified.

witness_location.description: Data center location. Pick one data center by using `GET /v2/mzr_locations` API.

hardware.description: Hardware configuration of the vSphere servers.

template_id.description: The template ID that maps to a preconfigured hardware specification to be ordered. To see supported templates, use the `GET /v2/templates` API. To customize your hardware configuration, use `customized_hardware`. This will be ignored if `customized_hardware` is also specified.

customized_hardware.description: Customized hardware configuration to be ordered.

server.description: Server CPU type of the hardware. To see supported server types, use the `GET /v2/server_types` API.

ram.description: RAM type of the hardware. To see supported RAM types, use the `GET /v2/ram_types` API.

disk_groups.description: Array of disk groups. If you are not using vSAN, you must specify this setting.

disks.description: Array of disk types for each of the local disks used by vSAN.

items.description: A disk type. To see supported disk types, use the `GET /v2/disk_types` API.

vsan_cache_disks.description: Array of disk types for each of the local disks used by vSAN cache.

items.description: A disk type. To see supported disk types, use the `GET /v2/disk_types` API.

vsan_compression.description: Whether or not to compress the vSAN disks. Applicable only when using vSAN. If true, the compression ratio on vSAN is set to 3.5.

edge_customized_hardware.description: Customized hardware configuration to be ordered.

server.description: Server CPU type of the hardware. Only one server type is supported for the edge cluster.

ram.description: RAM type of the hardware. To see supported RAM types, use the `GET /v2/ram_types` API.

uplink_speed.description: Network Uplink Speed. The default value is 10 GB. 25 GB is available only for certain server types and data centers.

private_only.description: Whether to attach to private network only or not.

shared_storage_config.description: A specified type of shared storage configuration.

iops.description: IOPS tier. To see supported IOPS and size combinations, use the `GET /v2/shared_storage_tiers` API.

size.description: Size tier. To see supported IOPS and size combinations, use the `GET /v2/shared_storage_tiers` API.

volume.description: Volume size of each storage in GB. For 10 IOPS/GB tier, the volume size can be in the range 20 - 4000. For other tiers, the volume size can be in the range 20 - 24000.

quantity.description: Number of storages of this type.

key.description: Bring your own license key. If not provided or empty, license key is included in the order.
Bring your own license key. If not provided or empty, license key is included in the order.
Bring your own license key. If not provided or empty, license key is included in the order.

license_type.description: For non-BYOL, specify which type of NSX license you want to order. Ignored when `key` is provided.

key.description: Bring your own license key. If not provided or empty, license key is included in the order.

license_type.description: For non-BYOL, specify which type of VSAN license you want to order. Ignored when `key` is provided.

credentials.description: List of access credentials of the endpoint.

version.description: Version of the endpoint, if applicable.

reason.description: Optional. A detailed description of the cause of the error.

history_id.description: Unique ID of the history record.

ips.description: List of IP addresses in the subnet.

available_ip_address_count.description: Number of available slots in the subnet.

host.description: Fully qualified domain name of the IP address.

disks.description: Array of disk types for each of the local disks used in disk groups.

items.description: Disk type. To see supported disk types, use the `GET /v2/disk_types` API.

raid_type.description: RAID type for disk groups. Currently only RAID_10 is supported.

vcs_type.description: Networking solution type. Use `vcs_nsx_t` to deploy a vCenter Server with NSX-T instance.

deploy_type.description: Deployment type. Use `mcv` to deploy a multizone VMware instance. Workloads instance.

total_count.description: Total count of tags attached to an instance.

offset.description: Offset value when query the tags.

limit.description: Maximum length when returning the list of tags.

items.description: List of tags attached to an instance.
